intro: Melanthera varians, commonly known as the variable melanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its foliage is alternate and lance-shaped, with hairy surfaces that aid in moisture retention. Melanthera varians produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
